element.name: 7 A Walk in the Garden- Cruagh/Glendoo by Kili or Bust, Unknown Cache (2.5/2.5)
element.long-description:
This walk is not in Wicklow but it is in an area which is well known by many South Dubliners as the gateway to the Wicklow mountains. It is worthy of the "Garden" title anyhow as it is very similar territory to much of Wicklow. The coordinates above are for the start of a walking trail which changes to open mountain moorland and it is not long at 5.5K with a total ascent of just 140m. You may need to see this cache information on a PC or similar! There is just about room for 1 car at the above coordinates but up and down the road within a short distance there are several more likely spots. Along the trail, on a clear day, there are some excellent and varied views of the city and a lovely vista down the length of Glencullen from Glendoo. You are likely to be treated to an orchestra of larksong all around both tops of Glendoo.
This is an easier hike (and cache) than most in this series but the ground underfoot can be quite sloppy in places so good waterproof boots are needed if there has been any rain. If you are fortunate enough to do this walk after a dry spell you would not need gaiters, otherwise they are highly recommended! ADVISABLE TO AVOID DURING THE DEPTHS OF WINTER!
Down the mountain walls From where a Pan's cavern is
Intolerable music falls.
Foul goat-head, brutal arm appear,
Belly, shoulder, bum, Flash fishlike;
nymphs and satyrs Copulate in the foam.
(W.B. Yeats)
Work out the puzzle to get the coords for Stage 1 (N53 and W006 are a given, ok?). There you will find 3 numbers (ABC) which you will need to use in the following formula to work out the first part of the final coordinates.
N53 13.BA(C-6).
After Stage 1 continue on the trail to N53 13.618 W006 18.198 where the trail forks to the left on to a narrower, more rugged path. Follow this to N53 13.848 W006 17.971 where there is a large gap in the fence. Turn right immediately after the gap and cross some rough terrain toward another fence and follow it to Stage 2.
The second part of the final coordinates are at Stage 2 N53 13.979 W006 17.786.
When you have the full coords follow around the corner of the fence and down toward N53 13.986 W006 17.662 where you will meet a bog path which will take you along another fence all the way up to Glendoo.
After retrieving the cache, the shortest route back is via Glendoo's "second top" where you need to head for N53 13.496 W006 17.804. The ground is pretty damp and boggy on the way down the slight slope and the start of the path may appear rough at these coords but it soon becomes the trail that started you off and it is a very simple walk back down to the start.
Please be clearly aware that anyone attempting this cache does so entirely at their own risk and that the cache owner has no liability of any sort and for any reason, accident or mishap.
Please be aware that cars parked in areas close to walking trails are vulnerable and they can be vandalised or stolen. Unfortunately this is an ongoing problem which is extremely difficult to solve. so there is a risk involved.
Please observe the country code to the best of your ability. Local landowners often generously allow access to upland areas across or through parts of their private property. Please, please be conscious of this and return the courtesy by keeping all gates closed, immediately and not on your way back!. Please use the gates where appropriate but if you have to climb over them then use the hinged side ONLY.
Please do not cause any damage of any sort to fences or barriers along the way.
element.additional-waypoints:
S21QPBE - G7 Stage 2
N 53° 13.979 W 006° 17.786
W11QPBE - G7 Left Fork
N 53° 13.618 W 006° 18.198
W21QPBE - G7 Gap in Fence
N 53° 13.848 W 006° 17.971
W31QPBE - G7 Turn to Glendoo
N 53° 13.986 W 006° 17.662
W41QPBE - G7 Track Back
N 53° 13.496 W 006° 17.804
element.url-name: 7 A Walk in the Garden- Cruagh/Glendoo

ul.li:
2010-01-20T20:00:00Z : Owner Maintenance by Kili or bust
Stage 1 has now been correctly replaced and should cause no further probelms. Hint added also!

2010-01-17T20:00:00Z : Found it by Jumpin Jiminie
Finally, I have a Walk in the Garden to my name!!!
I have most of them worked out but just waiting for some decent weather to get out there and grab them. Needless to say the recent snow made this terrain a lot more than 2.5 but I enjoyed every minute of it...thigh deep snow, mud filled boots, stunning views, sure what more would you want.
This certainly makes good practice for the tougher caches in the series...maybe even one day I will add the dreaded #1 to my belt. I can only dream!!!
TFTC now I am going to reward myself with a well earned ice cold beer!
Jamie

2009-10-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fjon
A short enough walk, but not too pleasant - once we got on the open mountain it was pretty windy and rainy. We parked at Cruagh road - probably a safer bet than on the road.

2009-10-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by Donnacha
Found with Fjon. Lots of wind and rain on the way up and it was quite boggy. Nice walk, thanks.

2009-08-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by toczygroszek
Simple puzzle but cache not so easy. Stage 1 was the hardest part. Both stages 1 and 2 are accesible for bicycle, but final oocation only when you push it [:D] TFTC!

wpt.name: GC1QPBE
wpt.desc: 7 A Walk in the Garden- Cruagh/Glendoo by Kili or Bust, Unknown Cache (2.5/2.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: 7 A Walk in the Garden- Cruagh/Glendoo
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:

After Stage 1 continue on the trail to N53 13.618 W006 18.198 where the trail forks to the left on to a narrower, more rugged path. After retrieving the cache, the shortest route back is via Glendoo's "second top" where you need to head for N53 13.496 W006 17.804. Please observe the country code to the best of your ability. Local landowners often generously allow access to upland areas across or through parts of their private property. Please, please be conscious of this and return the courtesy by keeping all gates closed, immediately and not on your way back!. Please use the gates where appropriate but if you have to climb over them then use the hinged side ONLY.
Please do not cause any damage of any sort to fences or barriers along the way.

N 53° 13.979 W 006° 17.786

N 53° 13.618 W 006° 18.198

W21QPBE - G7 Gap in Fence
N 53° 13.848 W 006° 17.971

W31QPBE - G7 Turn to Glendoo
N 53° 13.986 W 006° 17.662

W41QPBE - G7 Track Back
N 53° 13.496 W 006° 17.804
